visible_text:
Nellie Cordova






























About me


























Clear problems. Clean data. Real impact.
















Hi—I'm Nellie.


Curious, practical, outcome-oriented.





                    I'm a software engineer with a strong foundation in machine learning, completing an M.S. in Computer
                    Science with a specialization in ML. My work combines practical engineering discipline with hands-on
                    experience building end-to-end ML systems.
                  



                    Recently, I've focused on applied ML projects that blend vision, natural language understanding, and
                    retrieval-based techniques to build practical, end-to-end ML applications. I'm also exploring
                    agentic AI patterns at my own pace to stay aligned with emerging workflows in the field.
                  



                    Before my ML journey, I worked on a real-time payments platform where I contributed to Java-based
                    microservices, testing automation, CI quality gates, and regulated release processes. That
                    experience shaped how I think about reliability, monitoring, and building software that is safe to
                    ship.
                  



                    I'm excited about roles where I can apply both ML and solid software engineering to build systems
                    that are useful, measurable, and maintainable. If you're building products with meaningful
                    impact —across any industry— I'd love to connect.
                  












Specialization


ML-oriented SWE






Experience Level


Mid-level (SWE) 
 Early career (ML)










Education


M.S. CS (ML), Georgia Tech — in progress






Languages


English, Spanish












 Projects
                    







                    Let's Talk
                  


























Resume






















Professional Summary




Driven software engineer transitioning to ML, combining hands-on DL/NLP/RL with production-grade
                experience in microservices payments. Strong in experiment design, hyperparameter tuning, and
                metrics-driven iteration. Delivers features
                end-to-end.
              


Information






 Florida, USA


 cordova.nellie@outlook.com


 +1 (908) 764-7332


 linkedin.com/in/ncordovank


 github.com/cordovank








Technical Skills










ML / NLP —
 Python · PyTorch · scikit-learn · NumPy · pandas



                        · Transformers (ViT, GPT-2) · CNNs · RNN/LSTM · seq2seq · tokenization/embeddings ·
                        attention/memory · fine-tuning & transfer · classification · language modeling
                      










Data & Eval —
 Experiment design · HPO · cross-validation



                        · metrics (F1, perplexity, RMSE) · visualization/reporting (Matplotlib)
                      










MLOps / Backend —
 Docker · CI/CD · REST/gRPC · Kafka



                        · Jenkins/Maven · testing (JUnit, Cucumber) · API/perf testing (Postman, SOAP UI, JMeter) ·
                        logging/monitoring (Geneos)
                      










Languages & Tools —
 Python · Java · SQL · Git · Jupyter



                        · IntelliJ · JIRA · Bitbucket · Confluence · Anaconda
                      








Other —
 English & Spanish (bilingual)
                  






















Professional Experience
                






Software Engineer


 JPMorgan Chase & Co. | Tampa, FL


2019 - 2021


Real-Time Payments Platform




Contributed end-to-end across the SDLC for Java-based payments microservices and drove production
                    readiness.


Authored comprehensive operational runbooks—architecture, dependencies/configs, failure modes,
                    diagnostic checklists, decision trees, and step-by-step remediation—to enable fast triage, recovery,
                    and self-serve on-call; provided light support on monitoring/alerting dashboards with platform/SRE.
                  


Built and maintained test automation (JUnit, Cucumber); enforced CI quality gates (tests, static
                    analysis, coverage) to keep merges green, and executed functional/perf testing (Postman, SOAP UI,
                    JMeter).
                  


Managed regulated releases: compiled release evidence (test/coverage reports, change tickets,
                    approvals) to secure production sign-off; presented services to global production management.


Led/participated in agile rituals (sprint planning, backlog refinement); authored
                    technical docs; coordinated across time zones.








2019 - 2020




Salesforce Platform




Delivered Salesforce data collection and reporting features for a social-impact organization.


Gathered requirements from stakeholders, translated them into technical changes, implemented the
                    updates, and documented the work.


Enhanced a custom Visualforce UI for clarity and consistency, and automated survey creation with
                    declarative Flows to reduce manual setup and standardize templates.








ML Research Assistant


 CS Dept. @ William Paterson University | Wayne, NJ


2018 - 2019




Applied exploratory data analysis and knowledge discovery to augment prior hypothesis-driven work
                    on teen tanning behaviors.


Implemented and evaluated predictive models (KNN, Logistic Regression, clustering) in Python/R.
                  


Presented insights to faculty and students.
                    


























Education
                






M.S. in Computer Science (Machine Learning)


 Georgia Institute of Technology | Atlanta, GA


2022 - Present




Relevant Coursework:
 Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Reinforcement
                  Learning, Natural Language Processing, Network Science






B.A. in Mathematics | Minor: Computer Science


 William Paterson University | Wayne, NJ


2016 - 2019


Relevant Coursework:
 Database Management Systems, Data Warehouse & Data
                  Mining, Cloud Computing, Applied Regression Analysis


Magna Cum Laude • Pi Mu Epsilon (National Mathematics Honor Society)










Certifications
                






AWS Certified AI Practitioner
















2025






Group 2 Social / Behavioral Research Investigators and Key Personnel
                  
















CITI Program


2024
















Download Resume
        





            Preview resume (PDF)


















Projects


















 All Projects


AI


DL


NLP


User-centered


































RAG System with Guardrails






FastAPI


LLM


FAISS


































Plate2Recipe – Food Image to Recipe Generation






PyTorch


ViT


GPT-2


LSTM
































Memory-augmented QA System






PyTorch


NumPy


Tokenization


attention/memory networks
































Notification System Redesign






UX Research


Prototyping


Usability Testing
















 














Let's Connect!














I reply to thoughtful notes and real opportunities.


Open to ML/SWE roles, collabs — short intros welcome.



              Rather email?
              
cordova.nellie@outlook.com












Use the form — a few sentences and links are perfect.




































Leave this field empty
                    








 No mailing lists. I'll use your info only to respond.

about.text:
About me
Clear problems. Clean data. Real impact.
Hi—I'm Nellie.
Curious, practical, outcome-oriented.
I'm a software engineer with a strong foundation in machine learning, completing an M.S. in Computer
                    Science with a specialization in ML. My work combines practical engineering discipline with hands-on
                    experience building end-to-end ML systems.
Recently, I've focused on applied ML projects that blend vision, natural language understanding, and
                    retrieval-based techniques to build practical, end-to-end ML applications. I'm also exploring
                    agentic AI patterns at my own pace to stay aligned with emerging workflows in the field.
Before my ML journey, I worked on a real-time payments platform where I contributed to Java-based
                    microservices, testing automation, CI quality gates, and regulated release processes. That
                    experience shaped how I think about reliability, monitoring, and building software that is safe to
                    ship.
I'm excited about roles where I can apply both ML and solid software engineering to build systems
                    that are useful, measurable, and maintainable. If you're building products with meaningful
                    impact —across any industry— I'd love to connect.

ML-oriented SWE

Early career (ML)
